title: Handwritten looking font
content:
Hi,  
What is this font?  
Thank you!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122071257im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/type_5962.jpg)

 [‹ Chris Garrett portfolio](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122071257/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48183 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID these lead types? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122071257/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48105 "Go to next forum topic")
author: misalion

comments.content:
Not sure why you need to match this, but I scanned through the 300-font Handwritten Font ClickArt collection and this wasn’t there. Your next best bet is to look at Handwritten fonts in the free Dafont.com collection, or skim through Part 11 of my Script Font ID Guide.

Our usual advice is find something similar and use that, because this might be a one-off custom font done with someone’s own printing. You can make fonts like this for almost nothing.

- Mike Yanega
